chargeHist.descr: Battery to Public Transit Operator, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean K Reason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Public Transit Operator, etc., a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(6)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward any passenger/operator of Madison Metro Bus or BB.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: 4/15/16 Crt orders condtional jail time from the date of the signature on the order (4/15/16) until 8/21/16 to be served without huber.
